In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, we can create a function `wrap_string` to achieve this task. Here is the code:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_str, " ")
    output_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            println("Error: Word '$word' is larger than maximum allowed width.")
            return
        end
        
        if length(output_str) + length(word) > text_width
            output_str *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(output_str)
            output_str *= " "
        end
        
        output_str *= word
    end
    
    return output_str
end
```
This `wrap_string` function splits the input string into words and adds them to the new line only when it exceeds the maximum allowed width.

For example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("Hello World")) # Outputs "Hello\nWorld" 
```
